properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Adverse Winter Driving Conditions Due to Heavy Snow This Weekend. An unseasonably cool spring storm will deliver significant snow to the high mountain passes of southern B.C. Today, intense bursts of flurries will add further accumulations. Gusty winds will reduce visibilities in blowing snow. Snow levels will be unseasonably low, hovering between 1100 and 1400 metres. A transition from rain at the lower elevations to heavy snow near the passes will make for adverse winter driving conditions. Motorists are encouraged to consider delaying travel plans until early next week when the snow will ease in the mountains. Drivers should be prepared for winter driving conditions and are reminded that winter tires are mandatory until April 30th. Please check the highway forecasts before heading out and stay tuned for potential snowfall warnings. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T03:00:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T11:01:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4208597109.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots are expected this afternoon. Radar images show a line of thunderstorms over eastern Lake Erie is moving northeastward at 70 km/h. This line is expected to reach west end of Lake Ontario in the next half hour. These thunderstorms are capable to produce wind gusts up to 45 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system from the United States will affect the province of Quebec Sunday and Monday. Snowfall amounts of up to 15 centimetres are possible for Central Quebec. However, precipitation amounts could vary widely depending on the area as temperatures will be near the freezing mark. Some areas near and south of the river could primarily see 5 to 10 centimetres of snow, while locally, over higher terrain may see up to 15 centimetres. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult locally. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T07:33:35-00:00

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain today. Rain, heavy at times, is forecast to develop early this morning and continue through most of the day. Embedded thunderstorms are likely to accompany the rain at times. Total rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm are likely, with the highest amounts expected where thunderstorms occur. The ground in the area remains partially frozen. Since frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb rainfall, winter criteria thresholds of 25 mm with 24 hours is being used for this Rainfall Warning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:45 PM EST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorm over eastern Lake Erie. This line of thunderstorms is moving northeastwards at speed of 60 km/h. These thunderstorms are capable of producing very strong wind gusts up to 100 km/h, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-03-29T19:40:27-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard ending midday. Poor visibilities in blowing snow are ongoing in the wake of a low pressure system now moving through Hudson Bay. Winds gusting to 70 km/h and blizzard conditions will continue this morning before easing near midday. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Emergency Advisory Alert Issued By Ministry Of Health
properties.Summary:
Description: This is an update for the Emergency Advisory Alert issued by the Ministry of Health. If you or somebody you know attended the Christopher Lake snowmobile rally and supper on Saturday, March 14, you are advised to contact 811 as soon as possible. If you are experiencing signs of fever, coughing, or breathing issues, call 811 immediately.

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Locations: Northern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: until this afternoon. Remarks: Freezing rain mixed with ice pellets is expected to taper to freezing drizzle and flurries later this afternoon. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Pacific storm will continue to give snowfalll over the highway passes with 15 to 25 cm of snow expected for Rogers Pass and Kootenay Pass by Monday morning. The Coquihalla Hope to Merritt segment may see up to 15 cm by this evening. As the cold front sweeps across the province today, an unsettled airmass will result in brief but intense bursts of flurries over the highways with possible sudden reduction in visibility due to heavy snow. Be aware of sudden changes in road conditions and visibility, particularly near the highway summits. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
